moves.1. d4 c6 2. c3 f5 3. Bf4 Nf6 4. Nf3 e6 5: The idea was: g5, 12. Ng6, and if a7xN, h7, threatening Qh5+ if the pawn is taken (after exchange in h7 so to remove the knight). It is not accurate, I reckon.
moves.16. Be5: If he doesn't want to attack the knight, let's go on...
moves.16... Bd6 17. f4: I liked this move: if e4xf3, NxF3, and I save the knight with a solid center.
moves.23... Qb6 24. Rxe8: Or RxB, NxR, Rh7, recovering the piece.
moves.24... Kxe8 25. Rxg7: The g pawn will fall. Black resigns.
